text:
Paul Stanley (born January 20, 1952) is an American hard rock guitarist and singer for hard rock band Kiss.
Biography.
Born in Manhattan, New York City, U.S., on January 20, 1952. He moved to Queens, New York City in 1960. Paul was heavily influenced by The Beatles and the Rolling Stones image and was coming little by little the world of rock'n'roll. He played Elvis songs in his garage with a guitar he got for his birthday. After a while playing in a cover band called Uncle Joe, he recorded a single for CBS.
Career.
Kiss released their first album, called "Kiss", in 1973.
